synopsis: In episode #11 titled 'SOLOOOO', Ahir shares a personal and engaging account of his recent knee injury and the journey through the healthcare system, blending humor with deep reflections on life, loneliness, and self-discovery. Through candid storytelling and thoughtful responses to listener questions, he emphasizes the importance of self-acceptance and the beauty of human connections.
quotes: The way you live your life every day is how you end up living your life.
What happens when someone who does have responsibilities can't navigate the system? That's a really hard thing to do.
It's insane how many hoops you have to jump through to get the right diagnosis.
Loneliness and melancholy are beautiful feelings; sometimes they just point to a need of yours that isn't being met.
Are you able to feel joy by yourself? Can you enjoy a meal alone?
The ability to love and be loved does not go away, you just may not be able to feel it for a bit.
Cooking isn't that hard; ingredients are just Legos, waiting to be combined.
You have to give yourself small acts of happiness; a couple of cocoa in the morning, yoga a couple of times a week.
Relationships end, but the ability to love and be loved does not.
Open your arms if you want to be held; what's the worst that could happen?
